id.title: A string that uniquely identifies the job within the account.

displayName.title: The display name for the job.

commonEnvironmentSettings.title: The list of common environment variable settings. These environment variables are set for all tasks in the job (including the Job Manager, Job Preparation and Job Release tasks).
commonEnvironmentSettings.description: The list of common environment variable settings. These environment variables are set for all tasks in the job (including the Job Manager, Job Preparation and Job Release tasks).

poolInfo.title: The pool on which the Batch service runs the job's tasks.

onAllTasksComplete.title: The action the Batch service should take when all tasks in the job are in the completed state.
onAllTasksComplete.description: The action the Batch service should take when all tasks in the job are in the completed state.

onTaskFailure.title: The action the Batch service should take when any task in the job fails. A task is considered to have failed if it completes with a non-zero exit code and has exhausted its retry count, or if it had a scheduling error.
onTaskFailure.description: The action the Batch service should take when any task in the job fails. A task is considered to have failed if it completes with a non-zero exit code and has exhausted its retry count, or if it had a scheduling error.

metadata.title: A list of name-value pairs associated with the job as metadata.
metadata.description: A list of name-value pairs associated with the job as metadata.

usesTaskDependencies.title: The flag that determines if this job will use tasks with dependencies.

applicationTemplateInfo.title: An application template from which to create the job.
applicationTemplateInfo.description: An application template from which to create the job.

maxWallClockTime.title: The maximum elapsed time that the job may run, measured from the time the job is created.
maxWallClockTime.description: The maximum elapsed time that the job may run, measured from the time the job is created.

maxTaskRetryCount.title: The maximum number of times each task may be retried. The Batch service retries a task if its exit code is nonzero.
maxTaskRetryCount.description: The maximum number of times each task may be retried. The Batch service retries a task if its exit code is nonzero.

id.title: A string that uniquely identifies the Job Manager taskwithin the job.

blobSource.title: The URL of the file within Azure Blob Storage.

fileGroup.title: The file group in the linked storage account from which to download files.

path.title: The path within the file group to which output files will be uploaded.

OutputFileUploadOptions.title: Details about an output file upload operation, including under what conditions to perform the upload.

OutputFileUploadCondition.title: The conditions under which a task output file or set of files should be uploaded.
OutputFileUploadCondition.description: taskSuccess: Upload the file(s) only after the task process exits with an exit code of 0. taskFailure: Upload the file(s) only after the task process exits with a nonzero exit code. taskCompletion: Upload the file(s) after the task process exits, no matter what the exit code was.

name.title: The name of the environment variable.

value.title: The value of the environment variable.

maxWallClockTime.description: The maximum elapsed time that the task may run, measured from the time the task starts. If the task does not complete within the time limit, the Batch service terminates it.

retentionTime.title: The minimum time to retain the task directory on the compute node where it ran, from the time it completes execution. After this time, the Batch service may delete the task directory and all its contents.
retentionTime.description: The minimum time to retain the task directory on the compute node where it ran, from the time it completes execution. After this time, the Batch service may delete the task directory and all its contents.

access.title: The Batch resources to which the token grants access.

id.title: A string that uniquely identifies the Job Preparation task within the job.

id.title: A string that uniquely identifies the Job Release task within the job.

commandLine.description: The command line of the Job Release task.

environmentSettings.title: A list of environment variable settings for the Job Release task.
environmentSettings.description: A list of environment variable settings for the Job Release task.

maxWallClockTime.title: The maximum elapsed time that the Job Release task may run on a given compute node, measured from the time the task starts. If the task does not complete within the time limit, the Batch service terminates it. The default value is 15 minutes. You may not specify a timeout longer than 15 minutes. If you do, the Batch service rejects it with an error; if you are calling the REST API directly, the HTTP status code is 400 (Bad Request).
maxWallClockTime.description: The maximum elapsed time that the Job Release task may run on a given compute node, measured from the time the task starts. If the task does not complete within the time limit, the Batch service terminates it. The default value is 15 minutes. You may not specify a timeout longer than 15 minutes. If you do, the Batch service rejects it with an error; if you are calling the REST API directly, the HTTP status code is 400 (Bad Request).

retentionTime.title: The minimum time to retain the task directory for the Job Release task on the compute node. After this time, the Batch service may delete the task directory and all its contents.
retentionTime.description: The minimum time to retain the task directory for the Job Release task on the compute node. After this time, the Batch service may delete the task directory and all its contents.

userIdentity.title: The user identity under which the Job Release task runs.
userIdentity.description: The user identity under which the Job Release task runs.

pool.title: The pool specification for the auto pool.

OnAllTasksComplete.title: The action the Batch service should take when all tasks in the job are in the completed state.
OnAllTasksComplete.description: noAction - do nothing. The job remains active unless terminated or disabled by some other means. terminateJob - terminate the job. The job's terminateReason is set to 'AllTasksComplete'.

OnTaskFailure.title: The action the Batch service should take when any task in the job fails. A task is considered to have failed if it completes with a non-zero exit code and has exhausted its retry count, or if it had a scheduling error.
OnTaskFailure.description: noAction - do nothing. performExitOptionsJobAction - take the action associated with the task exit condition in the task's exitConditions collection. This may still result in no action being taken, if that is what the task specifies.

type.title: The type of task factory - taskCollection, parametricSweep or taskPerFile

packageReferences.description: A collection of packages from external package managers to be added to the node where the task runs.

TaskAddParameter.title: An Azure Batch task to add.

exitCodes.title: A list of individual task exit codes and how the Batch service should respond to them.
exitCodes.description: A list of individual task exit codes and how the Batch service should respond to them.

exitCodeRanges.title: A list of task exit code ranges and how the Batch service should respond to them.
exitCodeRanges.description: A list of task exit code ranges and how the Batch service should respond to them.

preProcessingError.title: How the Batch service should respond if the task fails to start due to an error.
preProcessingError.description: How the Batch service should respond if the task fails to start due to an error.

fileUploadError.title: How the Batch service should respond if a file upload error occurs.
fileUploadError.description: How the Batch service should respond if a file upload error occurs.

default.title: How the Batch service should respond if the task fails with an exit condition not covered by any of the other properties.
default.description: How the Batch service should respond if the task fails with an exit condition not covered by any of the other properties.

ExitConditions.title: Specifies how the Batch service should respond when the task completes.

exitOptions.title: How the Batch service should respond if the task exits with this exit code.
exitOptions.description: How the Batch service should respond if the task exits with this exit code.

ExitCodeMapping.title: How the Batch service should respond if a task exits with a particular exit code.

jobAction.title: An action to take on the job containing the task, if the task completes with the given exit condition and the job's onTaskFailed property is 'performExitOptionsJobAction'.
jobAction.description: An action to take on the job containing the task, if the task completes with the given exit condition and the job's onTaskFailed property is 'performExitOptionsJobAction'.

dependencyAction.title: An action that the Batch service performs on tasks that depend on this task.
dependencyAction.description: An action that the Batch service performs on tasks that depend on this task.

ExitOptions.title: Specifies how the Batch service responds to a particular exit condition.

start.title: The first exit code in the range.
start.description: The first exit code in the range.

end.title: The last exit code in the range.
end.description: The last exit code in the range.

exitOptions.title: How the Batch service should respond if the task exits with an exit code in the range start to end (inclusive).
exitOptions.description: How the Batch service should respond if the task exits with an exit code in the range start to end (inclusive).

ExitCodeRangeMapping.title: A range of exit codes and how the Batch service should respond to exit codes within that range.

affinityId.title: An opaque string representing the location of a compute node or a task that has run previously.
affinityId.description: An opaque string representing the location of a compute node or a task that has run previously.

AffinityInformation.title: A locality hint that can be used by the Batch service to select a compute node on which to start a task.

numberOfInstances.title: The number of compute nodes required by the task.
numberOfInstances.description: The number of compute nodes required by the task.

coordinationCommandLine.title: The command line to run on all the compute nodes to enable them to coordinate when the primary runs the main task command.
coordinationCommandLine.description: The command line to run on all the compute nodes to enable them to coordinate when the primary runs the main task command.

commonResourceFiles.title: A list of files that the Batch service will download before running the coordination command line.
commonResourceFiles.description: A list of files that the Batch service will download before running the coordination command line.

MultiInstanceSettings.title: Settings which specify how to run a multi-instance task.
MultiInstanceSettings.description: Multi-instance tasks are commonly used to support MPI tasks.

taskIds.title: The list of task IDs that this task depends on. All tasks in this list must complete successfully before the dependent task can be scheduled.
taskIds.description: The list of task IDs that this task depends on. All tasks in this list must complete successfully before the dependent task can be scheduled.

taskIdRanges.title: The list of task ID ranges that this task depends on. All tasks in all ranges must complete successfully before the dependent task can be scheduled.
taskIdRanges.description: The list of task ID ranges that this task depends on. All tasks in all ranges must complete successfully before the dependent task can be scheduled.

TaskDependencies.title: Specifies any dependencies of a task. Any task that is explicitly specified or within a dependency range must complete before the dependant task will be scheduled.

start.title: The first task ID in the range.
start.description: The first task ID in the range.

end.title: The last task ID in the range.
end.description: The last task ID in the range.

TaskIdRange.title: A range of task IDs that a task can depend on. All tasks with IDs in the range must complete successfully before the dependent task can be scheduled.
TaskIdRange.description: The start and end of the range are inclusive. For example, if a range has start 9 and end 12, then it represents tasks '9', '10', '11' and '12'.

start.title: The start of the parametric sweep range.
start.description: The start of the parametric sweep range.

end.title: The end of the parametric sweep range.
end.description: The end of the parametric sweep range.

step.title: The increment step between values of the parameter.
step.description: The increment step between values of the parameter.

displayName.title: A display name for the task.
displayName.description: A display name for the task.

commandLine.title: The command line of the task.
commandLine.description: The command line of the task.

resourceFiles.title: A list of files that the Batch service will download to the compute node before running the command line.
resourceFiles.description: A list of files that the Batch service will download to the compute node before running the command line.

outputFiles.title: A list of files that the Batch service will upload from the compute node after running the command line.
outputFiles.description: A list of files that the Batch service will upload from the compute node after running the command line.

environmentSettings.title: A list of environment variable settings for the task.
environmentSettings.description: A list of environment variable settings for the task.

affinityInfo.title: A locality hint that can be used by the Batch service to select a compute node on which to start the new task.
affinityInfo.description: A locality hint that can be used by the Batch service to select a compute node on which to start the new task.

constraints.title: The execution constraints that apply to this task.
constraints.description: The execution constraints that apply to this task.

userIdentity.title: The user identity under which the task runs.
userIdentity.description: The user identity under which the task runs.

multiInstanceSettings.title: An object that indicates that the task is a multi-instance task, and contains information about how to run the multi-instance task.
multiInstanceSettings.description: An object that indicates that the task is a multi-instance task, and contains information about how to run the multi-instance task.

applicationPackageReferences.title: A list of application packages that the Batch service will deploy to the compute node before running the command line.
applicationPackageReferences.description: A list of application packages that the Batch service will deploy to the compute node before running the command line.

authenticationTokenSettings.title: The settings for an authentication token that the task can use to perform Batch service operations.
authenticationTokenSettings.description: The settings for an authentication token that the task can use to perform Batch service operations.

packageReferences.title: A collection of packages from external package managers to be added to the node where the task runs.
packageReferences.description: A collection of packages from external package managers to be added to the node where the task runs.

RepeatTask.title: An Azure Batch task to add.

fileGroup.title: The file group in the linked storage account from which to take files.
fileGroup.description: The file group in the linked storage account from which to take files.

containerUrl.title: The URL of an Azure Storage blob container from which to take files, including any required Shared Access Signature (SAS).
containerUrl.description: The URL of an Azure Storage blob container from which to take files, including any required Shared Access Signature (SAS).

prefix.title: A prefix with which to filter the files from which to create tasks.
prefix.description: A prefix with which to filter the files from which to create tasks.

filePath.title: The path to the application template file.
filePath.description: The path to the application template file.

parameters.title: The values to assign to the application template parameters.
parameters.description: The values to assign to the application template parameters.
